author: Gloria Casas
title: Elgin man charged in April shooting of Devonte Turner Elgin Courier-News
text:
A 28-year-old Elgin man was arrested and charged with three counts of first-degree murder in the shooting death of 20-year-old Devonte Turner in April, Elgin police said.
William M. Ingram, of the 0-100 block of Poplar Creek Drive, was arrested Thursday at a Palatine hotel, according to a press release.
Turner was found in the area of Fleetwood Drive and McLean Boulevard April 30 with gunshot wounds and was transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead, the release said.
Elgin investigators had sought tips from the public and had continued investigating Turner's death, which led them to Ingram, according to police. The Kane County State's Attorney's office authorized the charges against him. No further details about the case against Ingram were released.
Ingram is scheduled to appear in bond call Saturday morning at the Kane County Sheriff's office.
Gloria Casas is a freelance reporter for The Courier-News.
